oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Rory Feek - 2017-03-11
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Rory Feek surrounding the release of his book "This Life I Live: One Man’s Extraordinary, Ordinary Life and the Woman Who Changed It Forever" from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 11, 2017. Interview conducted by Michael McCall. Includes audio from video and recorded audio excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rory Feek;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (06:42) Announcements by Abi Tapia / (07:28) Walk-in Music continues / (10:23) Opening comments by Michael McCall / (12:13) Audio of video performance of the song That's Important To Me from previous songwriter session featuring Joey and Rory / (15:45) Introduction of Rory Feek / (16:15) Rory comments on his feelings on the previously screened video / (17:13) Talks about daughter Indiana / (17:50) Talks about how he's currently doing / (18:59) Having mixed feelings about his recent success / (20:30) Talks about attending the Grammy Awards show and accepting the Grammy Award for their album / (22:57) Talks about the book coming about because of his blog / (24:23) Talks about writing helping him with the grieving process / (26:12) Compares writing his book to writing songs / (28:01) Talks about the story of his life being one of both struggle and faith / 30:25) Rory talks about his childhood / (32:14) Talks about moving around with his Mom /

(34:20) Talks about joining the US Marine corps due to Marine Corps recruiter and Merle Haggard / (36:51) Talks about the effect the Marine Corps had on him and single fatherhood / (38:00) Playing music and writing songs / (38:25) Moving to Nashville / (40:36) Signing a songwriting deal with Harlan Howard's publishing company / (41:33) Lessons he learned from Harlan / (44:24) Comments on the writing of and the inspiration for his first hit single Someone You Use To Know by Collin Raye / (48:15) Talks about his writing style and writing for Joey / (49:50) Writing songs from a humorous perspective / (51:00) Tells stories about writing with Paul Overstreet / (53:37) Audio medley of recordings written by Rory Feek / (57:00) Talks about meeting Joey and eventually getting married / (01:00:26) Talks about how the Joey+Rory duo came about / (01:02:43) SIGNAL LOSS / (01:02:50) Signal continues / (01:03:09) Tells story about the Gaither TV show taping and seeing it on television /
